result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Mudd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service.

No contact with C.A.
No possession of dangerous weapons.
No consumption of alcohol - defendant may be on the premises that sells alcohol for his employment.

SAFE assessment and follow through.
Assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the department.
Court orders firearm forfeited and any other items seized be returned to defendant if he is lawfully able to possess them.
Court finds the defendant is entitled to jail credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:06 am 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (False Imprisonment/DA)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 2 (DC/DA/Use of Dangerous Weapon)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: SAFE assessment and follow through; assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept; no contact with C.A.; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service; no possession of dangerous weapons; no consumption of alcohol -deft may be on the premises that sell alcohol for his employment; payment of court costs including 1 DA surcharge. 
COURT ORDERS firearm forfeited and any other items seized be returned to def if he is lawfully able to possess them.  
COURT find the deft is entitled to 3 days jail credit if revoked.

$2000.00 signature bond with first $300.00 in cash.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  No contact with victim(s):  C.A.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
